page.title: 16WATER MAMMALS.
page.content: Most water mammals grow up to be the size of a large rat such as the coypu. The coypu looks like a large plump, brown guinea pig with a long tail, webbed back feet and orange teeth.It escaped from a fur farm-belonging to South America.A very good swimmer and diver.It feeds on water side plants,burrows in banks.Coypu are controlled by trapping because of the damage they cause to the banks of the river.They sometimes eat crops.The Otter is another large mammal.ItÂ£s very shy and likes lonely places.Used to be common in the Broads but rare now.Glossy brown body.Flat head with lots of whiskers. Feeds on small fish.The water vole is very small and looks like a small rat, glossy brown coat and tiny ears.It eats plants,grass and minibeasts.
